content: tales of the garden shawl by marie-elyse dugal a collaboration with tippy tree yarns ravelry marie-elyse dugal instagram @marieelysedugal @tippytreeyarns #beatrixpottermkal #talesofthegardenshawl introduction inspired by the wonderful paintings writings and spirit of beatrix potter this shawl is a mix of delicate classic english stitches vintage style and a touch of whimsy large enough to wrap you in warmth on a cool evening light enough for spring and summer and cozy and fun enough to use as a scarf with your fall jacket or even winter coat i hope this shawl will make you smile year round and bring you joy * this pattern is for personal use only and may not to be copied reproduced sold or used for commercial purposes without the express permission of marie-elyse dugal thank you for supporting small designers �1 of 1� 5 yarn and notions - 4 x 50g skeins of fingering weight yarn at least 225 yards each 206 metres each referred to in the pattern simply as colours 1 through 4 - sample knit in tippy tree yarns tippy sock base using the beatrix potter shawl kit created for the mkal in june 2023 - the project may also be knit using 2 full skeins of complimentary colours using one colour for colour 1 and 3 instructions and the other for the colour 2 and 4 instructions it could also be knit in one colour using 2 skeins total yardage 900 yards - 2 stitch markers plus a progress marker to identify the front of your work - scissors and tapestry needle for weaving in ends needles 3 75mm us size 5 circular needles 80cm or 32 cable suggested gauge blocked 20 stitches = 4 inches in stockinette and garter 24 sts unblocked dimensions 62 inches 158 cm wide by 24 inches 60 cm deep abbreviations - co cast on - rs right side the work - ws wrong side of the work - c1 through c4 colours 1 through 4 - rh right hand needle - lh left hand needle - k knit - p purl - yo yarn over - k2tog knit 2 stitches together - p3tog purl 3 stitches together - sl slip stich - skpo slip knitwise knit pass slip_stitch over the knit one - kfb knit into the front then the back of the stitch - pm and sm place marker and slip marker - bobble bind off �2 of 1� 5 special stitches *to achieve the bramble stitch you will work a pattern of 4 row on two of those row the instructions will say * k1 p1 k1 into the next stitch this means you must not drop the stitch you created after the first k nor after the p only after the last k this means an increase from 1 st to 3 sts each time you will also be asked to p3tog in order to reduce the number of sts back to the original count *this video show how to achieve the k1
